website_summaries.verdict: Classic model from the leading name in Bluetooth communications for motorcycles.
pros: Extremely durable fiberglass composite shell with removable liner for cleaning
The latest Bluetooth 4.1 system with built-in speakers and microphone featuring advanced noise reduction
Four-way intercom up to half a mile
cons: Microphone is ineffective above 45mph (a problem with all open helmets)

customer_reviews.title: Still not sure ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to connect, nice idea to have the BT, speakers and mic already integrated with the helmet. I was very happy with it but in less than a month the ear cup just broke (see image). For a helmet of this price doesn't seem fair to have to buy new ear pads. I'll see what happens now, ill be adjusting the rating based on future experience
customer_reviews.author: Shadowfax

customer_reviews.title: Is it worth it or not ?
customer_reviews.text: The helmet is comfortable and looks good and meets DOT qualifications and the bluetooth is easy to use but it doesn't come with the latest software and the speakers great for calls not music music sounds like a $10.00 gas station headphone set was disappointed from that aspect but if you use it just for the phone up to 50mph you hear the call good but have to yell for person to hear you so all together a decent helmet but expensive so up to you and your needs on worth it or not
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Elsbree

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately 2 different helmets in 2 different sizes still would not fit right
customer_reviews.text: Looks very pretty holding it, but does not fit right at all. It's more like a total round shape instead of oval like someone's head. I used sizing guides, I consulted a customer service rep about the size before purchasing, and it just wobbled around like putting a huge stainless salad bowl on my head (even when fastened). Heard from others that the sound quality and microphone is totally useless after 45-50 MPH. What's the point? If I only rode 30 MPH everywhere I could just shout to my buddies instead of having bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Tilley

customer_reviews.title: Loving the SENA Cavalry
customer_reviews.text: Great helmet, the built in Bluetooth device works perfectly. The helmet speaker and mic works exceptionally (loud and clear). Received a call from my daughter while riding, she asked why I was yelling at her. The only reason I did not give the helmet a perfect score was due to the adaptive wind suppression ear covers, the fit doesn't hold fast, requiring numerous rechecks. Here is an Ideal, create a zipper removable wind suppression ear cover. Over all, this is a great unit, much easier to use in comparison to the SENA 20s.
customer_reviews.author: GilBat

customer_reviews.title: I like it, but....
customer_reviews.text: It is a comfortable helmet, size seems true to sizing guide. I agree with a few comments that sound is good with the ear pads, but gets rather muffled at highway speeds (I do not have a windshield). Clear as day below 55-60 mph. Easy to use once you study the quick star guide. One thing I would caution is that the Matte Black is easily scratched. My first ride out, got on the bike without any scratches, got off 20 miles later and a big while scratch on the top. I have a feeling the helmet with be black matte Plastidip in the very near future.
customer_reviews.author: JKG

customer_reviews.title: If you are accustomed to a boom mic SPH10h then don't buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Useless microphone at highway speeds. If you plan to use it at 45mph or below you will be satisfied. I have the Sph10h-fm from 2009 and it is far superior to the Cavalry in mic clarity. I sent the Cavalry back and will wait for the 30K release before replacing my sph10h. The Cavalry does not have the feature that allows you to hear your voice in the speakers while on the phone or intercom. Major oversight in the design. Also, the controls are less intuitive and less glove friendly than the jog dial units.
customer_reviews.author: KY Biker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent glossy finish
customer_reviews.text: Above and beyond expectations... Excellent glossy finish, High quality fit and finish throughout, a very nice helmet and the Sena is why we bought them they work with our current helmet comm system as well! Speakers wer loud enough to hear up to around 45-50 mph after that it's a guessing game-unlike the full face helmet system we have, but this is great on the Harley for puttin' around!
customer_reviews.author: casurfer

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and, most importantly
customer_reviews.text: Looks good and, most importantly, the Bluetooth works very well. When it's warm enough, I use this helmet and can get a clear signal from my iPhone. Interestingly, the sound quality is actually better if I listen while wearing earplugs, which seem to damp out the wind noise, and the sound comes through more than loud enough. As an FYI - sizing helmets is always tricky. I normally wear an XL (that's what my Aria full face is) but XL on this one is a touch loose on this - nothing I can't remedy by tightening the chin strap, though.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity and face sheild.
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect. It was a challenge to connect to 3 other helmets. It can be done but suggest connecting to one first, then have the two other guys connect then all click out except for the first helmet and then all click back in or double click until all connected. Lost one ear pad they don’t stay in very well. Also need a click down face sheild built in the helmet like my Scorpion or I would give it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Tazman

customer_reviews.title: Same that Harley sells  - Branded harley
customer_reviews.text: Nice Helmet. DOT rated. On bike hard to hear, especially with radio on, wind and motorcycle noise. I am just learning to use where it can be heard. I will be inserting provided "ear cups" to see if this works. Lots of features - just beginning to figure them out. I bought two 1/2 helmets and one full face - haven't tried full face, yet - however, expecting the sound to be a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great helmet! Does all that it claims
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this helmet! I do not have a stereo on my motorcycle so long rides were very quiet until I got this helmet. Connecting this helmet to my phone via Bluetooth enables me to listen to Pandora, make and take phone calls and generally just improves my ride, especially long rides, far more than without it. Love, love, love it! Using the phone feature, normally the other person is in disbelief that I am actually speaking to them while riding the motorcycle because they cannot hear the bike running. Truly awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Harris

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is Big
customer_reviews.text: Great helmet but I had to return due to sizing - I always wear an x-large but in this way too big - I reordered on the Sena site because they are offering 1/2 off and have inventory of mat black. A note the difference between the Calvary and Calvary Lite is the Lite only intercoms with one rider whereas the other does 4. Amazon wants $359 for large mat black - Sena is $ 174 .... good riding !
customer_reviews.author: Jb

customer_reviews.title: Love it - but it’s not for me.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a sena fan and used them for years. I recently discover 1/2 helmets and was excited to see sena was way ahead of me on that. Unfortunately this is almost unusable after 30 MPH - it’s nothing like the flawless operation what I’m used to in a 3/4 helmet.
customer_reviews.author: OWen

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable fit. Volume could be louder.
customer_reviews.text: The helmet fits well and is comfortable. As far as the sound, it can definitely be louder especially at higher speeds and wind intake. The ear flaps to help reduce the air flow and enhance the music are cheap and don't last long. This is probably the major defect of the helmet. The flaps fit into the helmet and started to rip after about a month.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T Wilger

customer_reviews.title: This thing works like it says it does
customer_reviews.text: This thing works like it says it does ! love the bluetooth to my phone took a call at 60 miles an hour with just a windscreen on and I could hear the call great and the person on the other end said they could hear me great also. This helmet is light and the controls are easy to use. It is comfortable also on a 6 hour ride it was great ! I will be using it on a 3000 mile trip soon for 10 days with another one to talk to on another bike .
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Limon

customer_reviews.title: Good construction, okay sound.
customer_reviews.text: Helmet has great quality with the exception of sound, that is at best okay. Have compared both moving and sitting still, not a great difference in the sound quality. It is not a purchase I regret by any stretch. I do like the helmet.
customer_reviews.author: Tony C.

customer_reviews.title: Something else is in the pipeline!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product. The Mike and speakers are all hidden in the helmet. The noise cancelation is remarkable. Something else is in the pipeline because everyone is selling them at close-out prices.
customer_reviews.author: Vidner D. McCraw

customer_reviews.title: Good for city riding
customer_reviews.text: Well let me start off by saying for what I paid I’m not upset compared to what they wanted in revzilla and other sites I paid 179$ compared to 300$ so in that regard I’m happy however the insulation is way too thick for summer riding in North Carolina, audio quality was good for a half helmet compared to the full face helmet I have already which is much louder at higher speeds but when you consider a half helmet allows so much wind it’s kinda hard to expect the same result
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Runs large. Buy a size smaller
customer_reviews.text: This is a great helmet and worth every dime. Only problem I ran into was that this helmet runs larhe. So I am returning the mexium for the small. But it firs and ferls great. Good bluetooth. If having it custom painted purchase flat bkack.
customer_reviews.author: Wynn

customer_reviews.title: Buy
customer_reviews.text: Great helmet. Bluetooth works well Comfortable light and fits well The only problem is the ear cups don’t snap in securely. I used a bit of 3m double sided tape and they are fine . Great helmet. Buy with confidence
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: I guess it's alright, sort of
customer_reviews.text: the built-in bill catches wind badly, hard on the neck. The Bluetooth used is outdated tech. It's heavy! Like really heavy! Questionnaire asked if it's warm - HOO-BOY is it EVER, especially in Texas in August! I'm not a fan, but I'll keep it for helmet law states if I ever travel far in fall or winter. WTF, the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: James Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Limited sound quality at higher speeds ( 60mph to 70 mph)
customer_reviews.text: I think they could have used higher end speakers in the helmet. The sound is okay but for the price in Canadian dollars I was expecting more. I just received the helmet and much to learn and remember to get the best benefit from the smart helmet. I think I will know more as far as rating it goes after a season of using it. I think it's important that someone else you ride with owns one so you will enjoy all the uses. I needed a new helmet and I decided why not have one that I can enjoy music and GPS.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Great helmet
customer_reviews.text: Love this helmet...so much that this is the 2nd one purchased... I loved mine so much my brother had me order this one for him!
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: I returned it.
customer_reviews.text: The helmet fit okay. The ear cups didn’t mount very firmly. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Helmet
customer_reviews.text: Helmet is pretty comfortable. Only downside which I knew would be an issue is when you are riding at higher speeds it is difficult to hear unless you put the included "ear flaps" on. Overall though love the product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bellofatto

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: Helmet is NOT comfortable and speakers are useless above 50 mph...don’t recommend at all
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Little pricey works great programming Bluetooth and coms takes a few till u get use to it.
customer_reviews.author: Ed B.

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: The best music quality, I wear a medium Harley-Davidson helmets and I bought the small size based on other reviews and it was a tad smaller than expected but it was ok after wearing it for a couple of rides. Very easy to clean and also very lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: light and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This helmet is light and comfortable,I can't seem to keep connected to the group, but my Sena is newer that the rest... Will update if things change
customer_reviews.author: Richard G Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Helmet does not pair with our motorcycle. Able to talk to each other but it picks up radio and echos. Can't listen to music through the bike radio. Too expensive to buy the adapter kit and according to Sena sound quality is lost. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi

customer_reviews.title: The perfect Harley-Davidson touring helmet
customer_reviews.text: This is the helmet I’ve been looking for. Perfect sizing, lightweight and good looking (matte black). No mushroom head look. Perfect sound making phone calls or listening to music. Comes with cushioned earpads for riding in fall. Overall the best halfhelmet I ever had!
customer_reviews.author: W.S.H.

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is. No goggles with this but BT is great!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the helmet just not the company that sold it to me. It must have been a demo model cause it didn't come with the full ear muffs in the box. Wasn't told it was a demo....
customer_reviews.author: JAY SINGER

customer_reviews.title: Please don't buy it.
customer_reviews.text: The BT us not working very disappointing. I could believe! I thought im doing something wrong, but no! I red the instructions from beginning to the end. I 99% is not working.
customer_reviews.author: Sandor Csutak

customer_reviews.title: Sena Cavalrty 1/2 helmet w/ Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.text: It works good, except have some problem hooking up 3 other people to my Inter-Com.
customer_reviews.author: Houghtons

customer_reviews.title: You can make phone calls and receive phone calls
customer_reviews.text: Like this helmet to keep me connected to others when I am on the bike.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Works as promised. My Harley is a bit loud but the helmet somehow finds my voice. Cuts most of the exhaust out.
customer_reviews.author: B-rye

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Helmet!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent helmet- solid, already fell and it completely protected my head when it hit the ground. I got up and road off.
customer_reviews.author: Donald E. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good, if you like half helmets.
customer_reviews.text: The helmet itself is nice, but the ear pieces keep sliding out. Great noise isolation, and you can definitely hear the Bluetooth up to 40 mph. Go for the Sena Savage of you're like more of a 3/4 helmet.
customer_reviews.author: rb_deuce

customer_reviews.title: Good helmet
customer_reviews.text: Very nice.. I wish the ear covers would stop falling off.
customer_reviews.author: Noodlenose

customer_reviews.title: Love to ride
customer_reviews.text: I bought this helmet for those long rides. I get tired of trying to use ear buds and the cord getting in the way. The sound quality is great and the Bluetooth does allow me to answer my phone while riding. The built in stereo is a great feature. Overall very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Toy W.

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery not even a week
customer_reviews.text: The directions need work but I figured it out pairing was a little confuseing everything works fine nice and loud can't wait to get on the road
customer_reviews.author: barry kizer

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and quality Bluetooth helmet
customer_reviews.text: Great for phone calls and intercom. Battery life is incredible and the helmet is the most comfortable I've ever worn.
customer_reviews.author: Carman VanSchaick

customer_reviews.title: Would be a great helmet if both speakers worked
customer_reviews.text: About this unit to ride with but unfortunately the left speaker intermittingly works. It's sucks to ride down the road and the right rear hears sound and left ear hears air.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Williams

customer_reviews.title: Too much for very little
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have talk back, isn't loud enough when traveling at high speeds, ear pads won't stay in. Not worth the money that was paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: loral

customer_reviews.title: Awrsome
customer_reviews.text: Love this helmet! Sounds amazing configuration is effortless! Super comfortable. If it had a retractable sun visor it would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Two key success criteria failures.
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed and decent feature set. I am accustomed to a Sena SPH-10H with the high quality noise cancelling boom mic that provides flawless clarity of your voice with the mic touching your lips. The SPH model also has a feature where you can hear your voice through the helmet speakers, giving you a sense of the volume and clarity of your voice. The Calvary's mic did not do well above 40 mph and not being able to hear myself was frustrating. The boom mic models work great at highway speeds (60-80 mph).
customer_reviews.author: KY Biker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent helmet
customer_reviews.text: The helmet was great, but I decided to sell my motorcycle before I got to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Cook Parks

customer_reviews.title: Roadglide
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly bluetooth is easy and very clear for a half helmet
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought for husband. He loves it. Can hear him clearly when he calls. Little to no background noise.
customer_reviews.author: brenda mccann

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I have to turn the sound down from full even without the ear cups.
customer_reviews.author: Kraig S.

customer_reviews.title: Great bluetooth half helmet.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit was I got a large which is what all my other helmets have been and it fit the same. Bluetooth sound and mic quality along with reception distance is very good. Surprisingly I can be easily heard through mic to other Sena helmet users. This helmet is smaller than most Harley Davidson brand half helmets and looks good. Only thing I wish was that it had slightly more padding in it.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Gunnell

customer_reviews.title: love this helmet
customer_reviews.text: love this helmet,we purchased 2,I can answer calls listen to music and receive gps instructions plus we can communicate over intercom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally a half helmet with a decent speaker system built in.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, clear (send and receive) even at 50mph on my Ultra Classic Electraglide. Everyone I have ever spoke to on the phone says they hear me fine with minimal background noise. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend the Helmet
customer_reviews.text: Recently went on a road trip to Leesburg. Talked with family members traveling at 70 MPH. They advised they heard NO background noise and sounded normal. Do to it being pretty hot I did not use the ear muffs so hearing them at 70 was not the best. Traveling at 50 MPH no problem hearing the them and my GPS. Great Product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits great, made solid, and actually sounds good. Highly recomended.
customer_reviews.author: strat10pro

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love the helmet. Would buy it again. Meets my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Petra Landress

customer_reviews.title: Big Thumbs Down.
customer_reviews.text: It did not work at all. I have other Sena units and people can hear me. With this one no one could hear me and my bike did not respond to my voice. Also there custome service is not very good. The seller was great. Sena, NOPE.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Cornblatt

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: The helmet perfect. Person who packed it, not so much. Please don't out labels over model numbers, or serial numbers to other customers. To register the product on SENA web-site you need them🙄
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Callahan

customer_reviews.title: I an very happy with the helmet
customer_reviews.text: Well I had the helmet out for the first trial run. I an very happy with the helmet. I was able to hear the music and GPS at highway speeds 75-80 MPH with no problem. I did have on the ear flaps though. It connects easily to my phone and my wife's CENA.
customer_reviews.author: Terry F.

customer_reviews.title: I was able to communicate between two helmets and also ...
customer_reviews.text: I was able to communicate between two helmets and also Bluetooth to my phone
customer_reviews.author: Mack

customer_reviews.title: which has gone great. Fit is exactly as described (for oval head)
customer_reviews.text: Riding season has not opened up here in Upstate NY yet, but I have been wearing this inside to learn how to use it, which has gone great. Fit is exactly as described (for oval head). Not as heavy as I expected, it weighs exactly the same as my Daytona carbon fiber half. Coms are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Carol A. Hargis

product_meta.title: Sena CAVALRY-CL-MB-L Matt Black Large Bluetooth
product_meta.description: Color:Matte Black| Size:LargeThe Cavalry comes pre-wired and ready to go with built-in Bluetooth capabilities and controls, so users can enjoy all of the great features of Sena's communication devices without the hassle of installing a headset. Chat with your buddies over the intercom system or take calls directly through your helmet with the built-in microphone for crystal clear conversations, and hear your music louder and clearer than ever before thanks to the built in half-helmet speakers on each side along with optional ear cups to boost the audio level while you're out on the open road. The technology included in this revolutionary helmet is our most up to date Bluetooth 4.1 features, so you can keep the chitchat going, share a playlist with another riding companion, listen to FM radio, or patch in your friend over the half-helmet intercom while you're on a phone call. The Bluetooth half-helmet does it all with top notch sound quality and Sena's Advanced Noise Control () Technology at ranges of up to 900 meters (0.5 miles) for 10 hours of Talk time. High quality speakers deliver crystal clear audio in a seamless design built right into the helmet. Engineered with Advanced Noise Control , Wind Noise Reduction, built-in SBC Codec and Wide Volume Control for maximizing the functionality of your Cavalry Half Helmet. Cavalry is the Bluetooth motorcycle half-helmet you've been waiting for. Linking up your Cavalry with the Sena Headset App (for Android or iPhone) allows you to configure device settings, create FM radio and Speed Dial presets, and access an interactive quick start guide. As with all Sena units, keep your unit up to date with our firmware upgrades.
feature_bullets: Included components: Cavalry Helmet with Matte Black, Ear Pads, Ear Plates, USB Power & Data Cable, Cavalry Helmet Pouch

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars125 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
